Speaker: star wars
Dialogue: Episode IV  A NEW HOPE  From the JOURNAL OF THE WHILLS  by George Lucas  Revised Fourth Draft January 15, 1976  LUCASFILM LTD.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Did you hear that? They've shut down the main reactor. We'll be destroyed for sure. This is madness!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: We're doomed!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: There'll be no escape for the Princess this time.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I should have known better than to trust the logic of a half-sized thermocapsulary dehousing assister...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Hurry up! Come with me! What are you waiting for?! Get in gear!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: At last! Where have you been?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: They're heading in this direction. What are we going to do? We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Wait a minute, where are you going?

Speaker: imperial officer
Dialogue: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Where are those transmissions you intercepted?

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: What have you done with those plans?

Speaker: rebel officer
Dialogue: We intercepted no transmissions. Aaah... This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: If this is a consular ship... were is the Ambassador?

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador. I want her alive!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: There she is! Set for stun!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Hey, you're not permitted in there. It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure..

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease! Now come out before somebody sees you.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Secret mission? What plans? What are you talking about? I'm not getting in there!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I'm going to regret this.

Speaker: chief pilot
Dialogue: There goes another one.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Hold your fire. There are no life forms. It must have been short- circuited.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Are you sure this things safe?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I've told you kids to slow down!

Speaker: fixer
Dialogue: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?

Speaker: camie
Dialogue: It was just wormie on another rampage.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I didn't know you were back! When did you get in?

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Just now. I wanted to surprise you, hot shot. I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon? Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission?

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Of course I got it. Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week. First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service...  ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I almost forgot. There's a battle going on! Right here in our system. Come and look!

Speaker: deak
Dialogue: Not again! Forget it.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: There they are!

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there! Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But there was a lot of firing earlier...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Hey, easy with those...

Speaker: camie
Dialogue: Don't worry about it, Wormie.

Speaker: fixer
Dialogue: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here. I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system. Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing...

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Lord Vader, I should have known. Only you could be so bold. The Imperial Senate will not sit for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away!

Speaker: commander
Dialogue: Holding her is dangerous. If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: I have traced the Rebel spies to her. Now she is my only link to find their secret base!

Speaker: commander
Dialogue: She'll die before she tells you anything.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Leave that to me. Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed!

Speaker: second officer
Dialogue: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship! And no transmissions were made. An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod. Send a detachment down to retrieve them. See to it personally, Commander. There'll be no one to stop us this time.

Speaker: commander
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: How did I get into this mess? I really don't know how. We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I've got to rest before I fall apart. My joints are almost frozen.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What a desolate place this is.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Well, I'm not going that way. It's much too rocky. This way is much easier.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What makes you think there are settlements over there?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Don't get technical with me.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What mission? What are you talking about? I've had just about enough of you! Go that way! You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: No more adventures. I'm not going that way.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: That malfunctioning little twerp. This is all his fault! He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm saved!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Over here! Help! Please, help!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail. I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty upset. He grounded me for the rest of the season. You should have been there... it was fantastic.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: You ought to take it easy Luke. You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Look who's talking. Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: I've missed you kid.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs. It's been so... quiet.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye... I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: I made some friends at the Academy.  ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding! How?

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I'm quiet.  Listen how quiet I am. You can barely hear me...

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You're crazy! You could wander around forever trying to find them.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own... It's what we always talked about. Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service. The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: And I'm stuck here...

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: I thought you were going to the Academy next term. You'll get your chance to get off this rock.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Not likely! I had to cancel my application. There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off. He needs me for just one more season. I can't leave him now.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important. What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?... You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It couldn't happen here. You said it yourself. The Empire won't bother with this rock.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Things always change.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I wish I was going... Are you going to be around long?

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: No, I'm leaving in the morning...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Then I guess I won't see you.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: Maybe someday... I'll keep a lookout.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, I'll be at the Academy next season... after that who knows. I won't be drafted into the Imperial Starfleet that's for sure... Take care of yourself, you'll always be the best friend I've got.

Speaker: biggs
Dialogue: So long, Luke.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Artoo-Detoo! It's you! It's you!

Speaker: first trooper
Dialogue: Someone was in the pod. The tracks go off in this direction.

Speaker: second trooper
Dialogue: Look, sir -- droids.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Wake up! Wake up!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: We're doomed.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Do you think they'll melt us down?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Don't shoot! Don't shoot! Will this never end?

Speaker: beru
Dialogue: Luke, tell Owen that if he gets a translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It looks like we don't have much of a choice but I'll remind him.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: I have no need for a protocol droid.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Sir -- not in an environment such as this -- that's why I've also been programmed for over thirty secondary functions that...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: What I really need is a droid that understands the binary language of moisture vaporators.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Vaporators! Sir -- My first job was programming binary load lifter... very similar to your vaporators. You could say...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Do you speak Bocce?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Of course I can, sir. It's like a second language for me... I'm as fluent in Bocce...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: All right shut up!  I'll take this one.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Shutting up, sir.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you? I want you to have both of them cleaned up before dinner.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done. Now come on, get to it!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: All right, come on! And the red one, come on. Well, come on, Red, let's go.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Uncle Owen...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: This R2 unit has a bad motivator. Look!

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Hey, what're you trying to push on us?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is in prime condition. A real bargain.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Uncle Owen...

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What about that one?

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: What about that blue one? We'll take that one.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Yeah, take it away.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir. He really is in first-class condition. I've worked with him before. Here he comes.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Okay, let's go.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Now, don't you forget this! Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Thank the maker! This oil bath is going to feel so good. I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It just isn't fair. Oh, Biggs is right. I'm never gonna get out of here!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Is there anything I might do to help?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I don't think so, sir. I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things. Not on this planet, anyways. As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I see, sir.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Uh, you can call me Luke.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I see, sir Luke.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Just Luke.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You got a lot of carbon scoring here. It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Have you been in many battles?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Several, I think. Actually, there's not much to tell. I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories. Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, my little friend, you've got something jammed in here real good. Were you on a cruiser or...

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What is what?!? He asked you a question...  What is that?

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir. Merely a malfunction. Old data. Pay it no mind.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Who is she? She's beautiful.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage. A person of some importance, sir -- I believe. Our captain was attached to...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Is there more to this recording?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Behave yourself, Artoo. You're going to get us in trouble. It's all right, you can trust him. He's our new master.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts. And it's a private message for him. Quite frankly, sir I don't know what he's talking about. Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with what we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Obi-Wan Kenobi? I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi- Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea. He's kind of a strange old hermit.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I wonder who she is. It sounds like she's in trouble. I'd better play back the whole thing.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system. He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: H'm? Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off! Okay.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: There you go.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, wait a minute. Where'd she go? Bring her back! Play back the entire message.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: What message? The one you're carrying inside your rusty innards!

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: Luke? Luke! Come to dinner!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, see what you can do with him. I'll be right back.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Just you reconsider playing that message for him.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: No, I don't think he likes you at all.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: No, I don't like you either.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: What makes you think that?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him. He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I thought he might have meant old Ben. Do you know what he's talking about? Well, I wonder if he's related to Ben.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: That old man's just a crazy old wizard. Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed. That'll be the end of it. It belongs to us now.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: He won't, I don't think he exists any more. He died about the same time as your father.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: He knew my father?

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: I told you to forget it. Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow. In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I think those new droids are going to work out fine. In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season. And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: You mean the next semester before harvest?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Sure, there're more than enough droids.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Harvest is when I need you the most. Only one more season. This year we'll make enough on the harvest so I'll be able to hire some more hands. And then you can go to the Academy next year.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: You must understand I need you here, Luke.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But it's a whole 'nother year.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Look, it's only one more season.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Yeah, that's what you said last year when Biggs and Tank left.

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It looks like I'm going nowhere. I have to finish cleaning those droids.

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: Owen, he can't stay here forever. Most of his friends have gone. It means so much to him.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: I'll make it up to him next year. I promise.

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen. He has too much of his father in him.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: That's what I'm afraid of.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What are you doing hiding there?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: It wasn't my fault, sir. Please don't deactivate me. I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning; kept babbling on about his mission.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Oh, no!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: That R2 unit has always been a problem. These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand. Even I can't understand their logic at times.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: How could I be so stupid? He's nowhere in sight. Blast it!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It's too dangerous with all the Sandpeople around. We'll have to wait until morning.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Luke, I'm shutting the power down for the night.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: All right, I'll be there in a few minutes. Boy, am I gonna get it.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You know that little droid is going to cause me a lot of trouble.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Oh, he excels at that, sir.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Luke? Luke? Luke? Where could he be loafing now!

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Have you seen Luke this morning?

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Uh? Did he take those two new droids with him?

Speaker: aunt beru
Dialogue: I think so.

Speaker: owen
Dialogue: Well, he'd better have those units in the south range repaired be midday or there'll be hell to pay!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: How's that.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this direction somewhere, but I don't see how that R2 unit could have come this far. We must have missed him. Uncle Owen isn't going to take this very well.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Sir, would it help if you told him it was my fault.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Sure. He needs you. He'd probably only deactivate you for a day or so...

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Deactivate! Well, on the other hand if you hadn't removed his restraining bolt...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Wait, there's something dead ahead on the scanner. It looks like our droid... hit the accelerator.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Hey, whoa, just where do you think you're going?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Master Luke here is your rightful owner. We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't talk to me about your mission, either. You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Well, come on. It's getting late. I only hope we can get back before Uncle Owen really blows up.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I think you should deactivate the little fugitive until you've gotten him back to your workshop.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: No, he's not going to try anything.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What's wrong with him now?

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Oh my... sir, he says there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Sandpeople! Or worst! Come on, let's have a look. Come on.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sandpeople all right. I can see one of them now.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Hello there! Come here my little friend. Don't be afraid.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Don't worry, he'll be all right.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day. You're fortunate you're still in one piece.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Ben? Ben Kenobi! Boy, am I glad to see you!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: The Jundland wastes are not to be traveled lightly. Tell me young Luke, what brings you out this far?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Oh, this little droid! I think he's searching for his former master... I've never seen such devotion in a droid before... there seems to be no stopping him. He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi. Is he a relative of yours? Do you know who he's talking about?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan? Now thats a name I haven't heard in a long time... a long time.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I think my uncle knew him. He said he was dead.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Oh, he's not dead, not... not yet.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You know him!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Well of course, of course I know him. He's me! I haven't gone by the name Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Then the droid does belong to you.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid. Very interesting...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I think we better get indoors. The Sandpeople are easily startled but they will soon be back and in greater numbers.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Threepio!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Where am I? I must have taken a bad step...

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Can you stand? We've got to get out of here before the Sandpeople return.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke. There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account. I'm done for.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: No, you're not. What kind of talk is that?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Quickly, son... they're on the move.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: No, my father didn't fight in the wars. He was a navigator on a spice freighter.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That's what your uncle told you. He didn't hold with your father's ideals. Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You fought in the Clone Wars?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I wish I'd known him.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself. And he was a good friend. Which reminds me...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I have something here for you. Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it. He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Sir, if you'll not be needing me, I'll close down for awhile.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Sure, go ahead.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: How did my father die?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: The Force?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I saw part of the message he was...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I seem to have found it.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars. Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire. I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed. I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit. My father will know how to retrieve it. You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan. This is our most desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan. I've got to go home. It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I can't get involved! I've got work to do! It's not that I like the Empire. I hate it! But there's nothing I can do about it right now. It's such a long way from here.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That's your uncle talking.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Oh, God, my uncle. How am I ever going to explain this?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Learn about the Force, Luke.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead. You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You must do what you feel is right, of course.

Speaker: tagge
Dialogue: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped. They're more dangerous than you realize.

Speaker: motti
Dialogue: Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander, not to this battle station!

Speaker: tagge
Dialogue: The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as....

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.

Speaker: tagge
Dialogue: That's impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.

Speaker: tagge
Dialogue: And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

Speaker: motti
Dialogue: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.

Speaker: motti
Dialogue: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort...

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: I find your lack of faith disturbing.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Enough of this! Vader, release him!

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: As you wish.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: This bickering is pointless. Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational. We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It looks like Sandpeople did this, all right. Look, here are Gaffi sticks, Bantha tracks. It's just... I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: They didn't. But we are meant to think they did. These tracks are side by side. Sandpeople always ride single file to hide there numbers.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: And these blast points, too accurate for Sandpeople. Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to. And that would lead them home!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Wait, Luke! It's too dangerous.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Uncle Owen! Aunt Beru! Uncle Owen!

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: And, now Your Highness, we will discuss the location of your hidden Rebel base.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: There's nothing you could have done, Luke, had you been there. You'd have been killed, too, and the droids would be in the hands of the Empire.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I want to come with you to Alderaan. There's nothing here for me now. I want to learn the ways of the Force and become a Jedi like my father.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Mos Eisley Spaceport. You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy. We must be cautious.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: How long have you had these droids?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: About three or four seasons.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: They're for sale if you want them.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Let me see your identification.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You don't need to see his identification.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: We don't need to see his identification.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: These are not the droids your looking for.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: These are not the droids we're looking for.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: He can go about his business.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: You can go about your business.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Move along.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Move along. Move along.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I can't abide these Jawas. Disgusting creatures.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Go on, go on. I can't understand how we got by those troopers. I thought we were dead.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded. You will find it a powerful ally.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Do you really think we're going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here. Only watch your step. This place can be a little rough.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I'm ready for anything.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Come along, Artoo.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: We don't serve their kind here!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: Your droids. They'll have to wait outside. We don't want them here.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder. We don't want any trouble.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I heartily agree with you sir.

Speaker: creature
Dialogue: Negola dewaghi wooldugger?!?

Speaker: human
Dialogue: He doesn't like you.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: human
Dialogue: I don't like you either.

Speaker: human
Dialogue: Don't insult us. You just watch yourself. We're wanted men. I have the death sentence in twelve systems.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I'll be careful than.

Speaker: human
Dialogue: You'll be dead.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: This little one isn't worth the effort. Come let me buy you something...

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: No blasters! No blaster!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: This is Chewbacca. He's first-mate on a ship that might suit our needs.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I don't like the look of this.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Han Solo. I'm captain of the Millennium Falcon. Chewie here tells me you're looking for passage to the Alderaan system.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yes, indeed. If it's a fast ship.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Fast ship? You've never heard of the Millennium Falcon?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Should I have?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: It's the ship that made the Kessel run in less than twelve parsecs!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I've outrun Imperial starships, not the local bulk-cruisers, mind you. I'm talking about the big Corellian ships now. She's fast enough for you, old man. What's the cargo?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Only passengers. Myself, the boy, two droids, and no questions asked.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: What is it? Some kind of local trouble?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Let's just say we'd like to avoid any Imperial entanglements.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Well, that's the trick, isn't it? And it's going to cost you something extra. Ten thousand in advance.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Ten thousand? We could almost buy our own ship for that!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: But who's going to fly it, kid! You?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You bet I could. I'm not such a bad pilot myself! We don't have to sit here and listen...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: We haven't that much with us. But we could pay you two thousand now, plus fifteen when we reach Alderaan.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Seventeen, huh!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Okay. You guys got yourself a ship. We'll leave as soon as you're ready. Docking bay Ninety-four.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Ninety-four.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Looks like somebody's beginning to take an interest in your handiwork.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: All right, we'll check it out.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Seventeen thousand! Those guys must really be desperate. This could really save my neck. Get back to the ship and get her ready.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You'll have to sell your speeder.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: That's okay. I'm never coming back to this planet again.

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: Going somewhere, Solo?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Yes, Greedo. As a matter of fact, I was just going to see your boss. Tell Jabba that I've got his money.

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: It's too late. You should have paid him when you had the chance. Jabba's put a price on your head, so large that every bounty hunter in the galaxy will be looking for you. I'm lucky I found you first.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Yeah, but this time I got the money.

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: If you give it to me, I might forget I found you.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I don't have it with me. Tell Jabba...

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: Jabba's through with you. He has no time for smugglers who drop their shipments at the first sign of an Imperial cruiser.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Even I get boarded sometimes. Do you think I had a choice?

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: You can tell that to Jabba. He may only take your ship.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Over my dead body.

Speaker: greedo
Dialogue: That's the idea. I've been looking forward to killing you for a long time.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Yes, I'll bet you have.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Sorry about the mess.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Her resistance to the mind probe is considerable. It will be some time before we can extract any information from her.

Speaker: imperial officer
Dialogue: The final check-out is complete. All systems are operational. What course shall we set?

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Perhaps she would respond to an alternative form of persuasion.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: I think it is time we demonstrate the full power of this station.  Set your course for Princess Leia's home planet of Alderaan.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: With pleasure.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Lock the door, Artoo.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: All right, check that side of the street. It's secure. Move on to the next door.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I would much rather have gone with Master Luke than stay here with you. I don't know what all the trouble is about, but I'm sure it must be your fault.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: You watch your language!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: He says it's the best he can do. Since the XP-38 came out, they're just not in demand.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It will be enough.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: If the ship's as fast as he's boasting, we ought to do well.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: Come on out, Solo!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I've been waiting for you, Jabba.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: I expected you would be.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I'm not the type to run.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: Han, my boy, there are times when you disappoint me... why haven't you paid me? And why did you have to fry poor Greedo like that... after all we've been through together.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: You sent Greedo to blast me.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: Han, why you're the best smuggler in the business. You're too valuable to fry. He was only relaying my concern at your delays. He wasn't going to blast you.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I think he thought he was. Next time don't send one of those twerps. If you've got something to say to me, come see me yourself.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: Han, Han! If only you hadn't had to dump that shipment of spice... you understand I just can't make an exception. Where would I be if every pilot who smuggled for me dumped their shipment at the first sign of an Imperial starship? It's not good business.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: You know, even I get boarded sometimes, Jabba. I had no choice, but I've got a charter now and I can pay you back, plus a little extra. I just need some more time.

Speaker: jabba
Dialogue: Put your blasters away. Han, my boy, I'm only doing this because you're the best and I need you. So, for an extra, say twenty percent I'll give you a little more time... but this is it. If you disappoint me again, I'll put a price on your head so large you won't be able to go near a civilized system for the rest of your short life.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Jabba, I'll pay you because it's my pleasure.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What a piece of junk.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: She'll make point five beyond the speed of light. She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts, kid. I've added some special modifications myself.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: We're a little rushed, so if you'll hurry aboard we'll get out of here.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Hello, sir.

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Which way?

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: All right, men. Load your weapons!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Stop that ship!

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: Blast 'em!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Chewie, get us out of here!

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Oh, my. I'd forgotten how much I hate space travel.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: It looks like an Imperial cruiser. Our passengers must be hotter than I thought. Try and hold them off. Angle the deflector shield while I make the calculations for the jump to light speed.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Stay sharp! There are two more coming in; they're going to try to cut us off.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Why don't you outrun them? I thought you said this thing was fast.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Watch your mouth, kid, or you're going to find yourself floating home. We'll be safe enough once we make the jump to hyperspace. Besides, I know a few maneuvers. We'll lose them!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Here's where the fun begins!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How long before you can make the jump to light speed?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: It'll take a few moments to get the coordinates from the navi-computer.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Are you kidding? At the rate they're gaining...

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Traveling through hyperspace isn't like dusting crops, boy! Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova and that'd end your trip real quick, wouldn't it?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What's that flashing?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: We're losing our deflector shield. Go strap yourself in, I'm going to make the jump to light speed.

Speaker: motti
Dialogue: We've entered the Alderaan system.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader's leash. I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Charming to the last. You don't know how hard I found it signing the order to terminate your life!

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: I surprised you had the courage to take the responsibility yourself!

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Princess Leia, before your execution I would like you to be my guest at a ceremony that will make this battle station operational. No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: The more you tighten your grip, Tarkin, the more star systems will slip through your fingers.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Not after we demonstrate the power of this station. In a way, you have determined the choice of the planet that'll be destroyed first. Since you are reluctant to provide us with the location of the Rebel base, I have chosen to test this station's destructive power... on your home planet of Alderaan.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: No! Alderaan is peaceful. We have no weapons. You can't possibly...

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: You would prefer another target? A military target? Then name the system!

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: I grow tired of asking this. So it'll be the last time. Where is the Rebel base?

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: Dantooine.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: They're on Dantooine.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: There. You see Lord Vader, she can be reasonable.  Continue with the operation. You may fire when ready.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: You're far too trusting. Dantooine is too remote to make an effective demonstration. But don't worry. We will deal with your Rebel friends soon enough.

Speaker: leia
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Commence primary ignition.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Are you all right? What's wrong?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I felt a great disturbance in the Force... as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced. I fear something terrible has happened.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You'd better get on with your exercises.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Well, you can forget your troubles with those Imperial slugs. I told you I'd outrun 'em.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Don't everyone thank me at once.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Anyway, we should be at Alderaan about oh-two-hundred hours.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: Now be careful, Artoo.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: He made a fair move. Screaming about it won't help you.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Let him have it. It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: That's 'cause droids don't pull people's arms out of their socket when they lose. Wookiees are known to do that.

Speaker: threepio
Dialogue: I see your point, sir. I suggest a new strategy, Artoo. Let the Wookiee win.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Remember, a Jedi can feel the Force flowing through him.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You mean it controls your actions?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Partially. But it also obeys your commands.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Hokey religions and ancient weapons are no match for a good blaster at your side, kid.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You don't believe in the Force, do you?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Kid, I've flown from one side of this galaxy to the other. I've seen a lot of strange stuff, but I've never seen anything to make me believe there's one all-powerful force controlling everything. There's no mystical energy field that controls my destiny.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: It's all a lot of simple tricks and nonsense.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I suggest you try it again, Luke.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: This time, let go your conscious self and act on instinct.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: With the blast shield down, I can't even see. How am I supposed to fight?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Your eyes can deceive you. Don't trust them.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Stretch out with your feelings.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You see, you can do it.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I call it luck.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: In my experience, there's no such thing as luck.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Look, going good against remotes is one thing. Going good against the living? That's something else.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Looks like we're coming up on Alderaan.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: You know, I did feel something. I could almost see the remote.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That's good. You have taken your first step into a larger world.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: officer cass
Dialogue: Our scout ships have reached Dantooine. They found the remains of a Rebel base, but they estimate that it has been deserted for some time. They are now conducting an extensive search of the surrounding systems.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: She lied! She lied to us!

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: I told you she would never consciously betray the Rebellion.

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Terminate her... immediately!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Stand by, Chewie, here we go. Cut in the sublight engines.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: What the...? Aw, we've come out of hyperspace into a meteor shower. Some kind of asteroid collision. It's not on any of the charts.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Our position is correct, except... no, Alderaan!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What do you mean? Where is it?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Thats what I'm trying to tell you, kid. It ain't there. It's been totally blown away.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: What? How?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Destroyed... by the Empire!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: The entire starfleet couldn't destroy the whole planet. It'd take a thousand ships with more fire power than I've...

Speaker: han
Dialogue: There's another ship coming in.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Maybe they know what happened.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's an Imperial fighter.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It followed us!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: No. It's a short range fighter.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: There aren't any bases around here. Where did it come from?

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It sure is leaving in a big hurry. If they identify us, we're in big trouble.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Not if I can help it. Chewie...jam it's transmissions.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It'd be as well to let it go. It's too far out of range.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Not for long...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: A fighter that size couldn't get this deep into space on its own.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: It must have gotten lost, been part of a convoy or something.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Well, he ain't going to be around long enough to tell anyone about us.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Look at him. He's headed for that small moon.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I think I can get him before he gets there... he's almost in range.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That's no moon! It's a space station.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: It's too big to be a space station.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: I have a very bad feeling about this.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Yeah, I think your right. Full reverse! Chewie, lock in the auxiliary power.

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Why are we still moving towards it?

Speaker: han
Dialogue: We're caught in a tractor beam! It's pulling us in!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: But there's gotta be something you can do!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: There's nothin' I can do about it, kid. I'm in full power. I'm going to have to shut down. But they're not going to get me without a fight!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You can't win. But there are alternatives to fighting.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: To you stations!  Come with me.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Close all outboard shields! Close all outboard shields!

Speaker: tarkin
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: We've captured a freighter entering the remains of the Alderaan system. It's markings match those of a ship that blasted its way out of Mos Eisley.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: They must be trying to return the stolen plans to the princess. She may yet be of some use to us.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Unlock one-five-seven and nine. Release charges.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: There's no one on board, sir. According to the log, the crew abandoned ship right after takeoff. It must be a decoy, sir. Several of the escape pods have been jettisoned.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Did you find any droids?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: No, sir. If there were any on board, they must also have jettisoned.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: Send a scanning crew on board. I want every part of this ship checked.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: vader
Dialogue: I sense something... a presence I haven't felt since...

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Get me a scanning crew in here on the double. I want every part of this ship checked!

Speaker: luke
Dialogue: Boy, it's lucky you had these compartments.

Speaker: han
Dialogue: I use them for smuggling. I never thought I'd be smuggling myself in them. This is ridiculous. Even if I could take off, I'd never get past the tractor beam.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Leave that to me!

Speaker: han
Dialogue: Damn fool. I knew that you were going to say that!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Who's the more foolish... the fool or the fool who follows him?

Speaker: trooper
Dialogue: The ship's all yours. If the scanners pick up anything, report it immediately. All right, let's go.

Speaker: han's voice
Dialogue: Hey down there, could you give us a hand with this?

Speaker: gantry officer
Dialogue: TX-four-one-two. Why aren't you at your post? TX-four-one-two, do you copy?

Speaker: gantry officer
Dialogue: Take over. We've got a bad transmitter. I'll see what I can do.

Speaker: luke
